fields.Title of Presentation: Electronic Texts versus Conventional Texts: Students' Purchase Decisions, Utilization Patterns, Learning Outcomes and Environmental Impacts
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: 40th Annual Meeting of the Decision Science Institute
fields.Description/Abstract: Electronic textbooks are increasingly marketed as alternatives to conventional hard-copy textbooks. E-texts are often presented as a win-win solution because they are assumed to provide the same educational value as hard-copy textbooks, but at a lower price and in an environmentally friendly manner. In this study, we investigate the difference between e-texts and hard-copy textbooks in terms of their learning outcomes, their carbon footprint and students’ overall patterns of use.
